home.headline: Sweet Light Studios is a full service photography studio located in South San Francisco, California serving the SF Bay Area.  We are dedicated to creating remarkable photos for incredible people!
copy: We offer studio style photography sessions at our location or yours,
radiant gallery prints and folio packages.
Specializing in Legacy Family Portraiture of Loved Ones, Personal Branding Headshots,
Corporate Business Portraits, Glamorous Makeover Photography Sessions,
Commercial Product Photography and Food Photography.
See yourself in a new light, In a Sweet Light, Today!

loved-ones.headline: There is nothing more valuable than pictures of your family & loved ones.
copy: We photograph Legacy Portraits of Family and Loved Ones to have and to hold, forever.
We believe all families should Exist In Photographs!
Family Milestones such as Engagement and Bridal Portraits, Maternity and New Baby Keepsakes
are our specialty, in addition to Annual Portraits for the Holidays.

branding.headline: There is nothing more important than making a great first impression.
copy: Want to make a great impact online?  Job-seekers & Entrepreneurs love our head-shot sessions.
Need a fresh set of Images to enhance your personal branding library?
Jet your exposure with our unique studio business corporate portraits and brand image sessions!
Hair & Makeup Styling *:
-- None (you are responsible for you hair & makeup).
-- Light (we will provide light hair, light makeup retouching, and for men light grooming).
Note: If you need full makeup and hair, see our makeover sessions or request a custom quote.

makeovers.headline: There is nothing more life-changing than a Makeover Photography Session.
copy: To be sure you look and feel your absolute best for your portrait session!
Bring your best friend, mother, sister or lover to share in the experience and make it a fun Girls Day Out!.
Apprehensive?  Camera Shy?  No worries, let us help you see yourself in a new light confidently!
Our skilled professional makeup artists will pamper and glam you up while bringing out your inner confidence,
and our photographers will coach you with love to bring out your naturally inherent beauty!

commercial.headline: Nothing is more important to online sales than great photos of your products
copy: We offer crisp, clean product photography services that feature your product in the best light.
Food photography and Product Photography in our studio or at your location.

pricing.headline: We offer different price points and special offers.
copy: Compare our quality and pricing with anyone!

commercial-studio.headline: Nothing is more important to online sales than great photos of your products
copy: We offer crisp, clean product photography services that feature your product in the best light.
Food photography and Product Photography in our studio are our specialty.
We are one of the few studios that can make clear and reflective products look good.
Luminosity Choices *:
-- Matte (your products are not shiny or reflective)
-- Reflective (your products are shiny and reflect the world around)
-- Transparent or White (your products are clear and see through or all / mostly white)
Retouching Choices *:
-- None - no retouching, images straight out of the camera
-- Standard - Spots Scratches & Fingermarks removed.
-- Remove Background - Product looks like it's floating on a clear background.
-- Add Dropshadow - Background removed to a pure White background with a drop shadow where product contacts the floor.
-- Custom - Changing label colors repairing broken seams chips etc.
Styling *:
Styling is preparing and placing the item in the space to be photographed.
When models are involved additional stylists and posing are sometimes involved,
leading to extra studio time being required.

commercial-on-location.headline: Nothing is more important to online sales than great photos of your products
copy: We offer crisp, clean product photography services that feature your product in the best light.
We are willing to travel up to 25 miles from our studio to do commercial on location work.
We will setup our portable studio at your site and photograph your products or food.
Luminosity Choices *:
-- Matte (your products are not shiny or reflective)
-- Reflective (your products are shiny and reflect the world around)
-- Transparent or White (your products are clear and see through or all / mostly white)
Retouching Choices *:
-- None - no retouching, images straight out of the camera
-- Standard - Spots Scratches & Fingermarks removed.
-- Remove Background - Product looks like it's floating on a clear background.
-- Add Dropshadow - Background removed to a pure White background with a drop shadow where product contacts the floor.
-- Custom - Changing label colors repairing broken seams chips etc.
Styling *:
Styling is preparing and placing the item in the space to be photographed.
When models are involved additional stylists and posing are sometimes involved,
leading to extra studio time being required.

commercial-online.headline: Nothing is more important to online sales than great photos of your products
copy: We offer crisp, clean product photography services that feature your product in the best light.
With online services, you fill out a simple form above, ship us your products,
we photograph them and send you the images electronically.
If you include a prepaid return shipping label, we will send your products back.
It's just that simple!
Luminosity *: - reflectivity or transparency of the product.
-- Matte (your products are not shiny or reflective).
-- Reflective (your products are shiny and reflect the world around).
-- Transparent or White (your products are clear and see through or all / mostly white).
Product Angle *: - how the product is turned in reference to the camera.
-- 90 degrees right (The camera sees the right side of the product).
-- 45 degrees right (The camera sees a 2/3 view of the right side of the product).
-- Front (The camera sees the front of the product).
----- Note: If there is a logo on one side of the product then that is the front.
-- 45 degrees left (The camera sees a 2/3 view of the left side of the product).
-- 90 degrees left (The camera sees the left side of the product).
-- Back (The camera sees the back of the product).
Retouching *: - professional Photoshop work.
-- None - no retouching, images straight out of the camera.
-- Standard - Spots Scratches & Fingermarks removed.
-- Remove Background - Product looks like it's floating on a clear background.
-- Add Dropshadow - Background removed to a pure White background with a drop shadow where product contacts the floor.
-- Custom - Changing label colors repairing broken seams chips etc.
Note: Please refer to the associated product images for a better understanding of the options.

contactForm.additionalText: Give us a clue, so we can help you ;-)

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
copy: What clothes should I wear to my Portrait Session?
Solid colors are best as patterns distract from your face.
Headshots only show the top of your body, so that is what is important.
Full lengths will need garments and shoes.
Be sure to include a solid black or solid white.<br /
For families try to match colors.
Should I go buy new clothes, get my hair done before my Portrait Session?
Yes, of course!
You can turn your photo session into a wonderful experience through primping and shopping.
Can I bring a friend with me?
Yes, of course!
Bring your mother, your sister, your best friend and let's turn it into a Girls Day Out.
Please let us know when you are bringing others and if they will be part of the shoot.
How do your portrait sessions work?
We have a variety of portrait sessions to fit many needs,
from quick headshots to mini-sessions to full makeover glamour sessions.
I try to make sessions relaxed and fun, using a variety of poses while gently coaching emotion
and energy through the lens to make a amazing portraits that youâ€™ll love.
How long do your Portrait Sessions take?
On average sessions last about thirty minutes for headshots,
an hour for mini-sessions and up to four hours for makeover sessions.
If you are in a rush, please let us know before you arrive.
When can I schedule my Portrait Session?
Time slots are available Tuesday through Sunday 10am - 3pm.
Do you do custom orders?
Yes. We are flexible to accommodate your needs.
Please contact us with your ideas!

credits.title: Credits for the Wonderful Technology used on this website

roll.title: Hypertext Markup Language V5 (HTML5)
details: HTML5 is a markup language used for structuring and presenting content on the World Wide Web.
Even when coded using React and Javascript, HTM5 tags are often used directly in the code.
By the time a React app reaches the browser, it has been converted to HTML5.

roll.title: Cascading Style Sheets V3 (CSS3)
details: CSS3 is a language used for describing the presentation of a markup document.
It was used to change the presentation of most of the HTML uses on the website.

roll.title: Javascript ECMAScript V6 (ES6)
details: ES6 is a trademarked scripting-language specification created to standardize JavaScript.
The ES6 version of Javascript was used to code most of the website using fat arrows, extended objects, classes, and shorthand notations.

roll.title: Node.js
details: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript run-time environment for executing JavaScript code server-side.
It needs to be installed prior to installing NPM or any of the NPM modules used for creating the website.

roll.title: Node NPM
details: Node npm is a package manager for the JavaScript programming language.
It was used to install most of the software used by this website.

roll.title: Git
details: Git is a version control system for tracking changes in computer files.
It was used to backup the website software to github and install the website on Heroku.

roll.title: Create React App
details: Create React apps with no build configuration.
It was used to create a skeleton react project used for this Website.

roll.title: WebPack
details: Webpack is a bundler for modules. It can bundle JavaScript or transform, bundle, or package just about any resource or asset for usage in a browser.
It is one of the packages installed automatically by Create React App.
Used by the skeleton created by Create React App to bundle up the javascript, resources and assets, prior to launching the site

roll.title: React
details: React is an open-source JavaScript library for building user interfaces.
It is one of the packages installed automatically by Create React App.
Used for creating most of the Sweet Light Studios Website.

roll.title: Redux
details: Redux is an open-source JavaScript library designed for managing application state.
It was installed via NPM directly after Create React App created the React Skeleton.
It was used for managing the state for most of the Sweet Light Studios Website.

roll.title: React Router
details: React Router is a collection of navigational components that compose declaratively with your application.
It was installed via NPM and used to translate Sweet Sight studios endpoint urls to switch to different react components via the article_router.js component.

roll.title: Axios
details: Promise based HTTP client for the browser and Node.
It was used to call endpoints on a number of sites and return promises of JSON data.

roll.title: Redux Promise
details: FSA-compliant promise middleware for Redux.
Installed via NPM and was used to call the Redux reducers with the JSON from resolved Axios promises.

roll.title: HTML React Parser
details: The parser converts an HTML string to React Element(s).
Installed via NPM and used to parse HTML string data from config and endpoints into React Components.

roll.title: React Bootstrap
details: React-Bootstrap is a library of reusable front-end components.
It was installed via NPM and used to give this site a consistent look and feel on mobile as well as standard devices.

roll.title: React Slick Carousel
details: Carousel component built with React. It is a react port of slick carousel.
Installed via NPM and used to show carousels of images in many of the primary articles.

roll.title: React Parallax
details: A React Component for parallax effect.
Installed via NPM and used to give the parallax animation effect in the FAQ article.

roll.title: React Dom Confetti
details: A react component to trigger confetti explosions on state changes.
Installed via NPM and used to add a confetti effect in the Thank You article.

roll.title: React Reveal
details: Adds reveal animation to any React component. It is compatible with 'animate.css'.
Installed via NPM and used in this article along with aniate.css to perform the scroll based animations.

roll.title: amimate.css
details: A cross-browser library of CSS animations.
Downloaded to the src folder and used along with react-reveal to perform the scroll based animations.

roll.title: Shopify Buy SDK
details: The 'shopify-buy' package give a way to getting information from a shopify.com store.
Installed via NPM and used to display Shopify store information in both English and French.
Supports product, collections, cart and online ordering in the website pricing articles.

roll.title: Wordpress REST API
details: Endpoints to access data in a Wordpress.com Blog.
Used for displaying English and French Wordpress.com Blogs in the Website.

roll.title: YouTube Video Endpoint
details: End Points for embedding a YouTube Video.
Used to display a video about the website in the credits article.

roll.title: Google Maps API
details: Endpoints for getting Google Maps.
It was used to display a map to Sweet Light Studios in the contacts article.

roll.title: Formspree io
details: Endpoints for an easy HTML form that sends through email.
It was used to send the contact form to Sweet Light Studios via email.

roll.title: AirVisual API
details: Endpoints for getting real time air quality information.
It was used in the Air Quality button display in the contacts article.

roll.title: React Social Icons
details: Standard Social Icons for the most widely used social sites.
Installed via NPM and was used in the  social buttons bar on the bottom of each page.

roll.title: Site Icon
details: The Site Icon is used in the browser tab when a browser is viewing Sweet Light Studios.
It is licensed as Linkware so a back-link to http://icons8.com is required.

roll.title: American Flag
details: The American Flag Icon is used as a button in the social bar to change to English.
It is licensed as Linkware so a back-link to http://icons8.com is required.

roll.title: French Flag
details: The French Flag Icon is used as a button in the social bar to change to French.
It is licensed as Linkware so a back-link to http://icons8.com is required.

roll.title: Mail Envelope
details: The Mail Envelope is used as a button in the social bar to send an email to Sweet Light Studios.
It is licensed as Linkware so a back-link to flaticon is required.

roll.title: Thank You GIF
details: The Thank You GIF is from giphy.com
Is is used as the background image in the thank you article.

roll.title: Chrome Browser + Developer Tools
details: Google Chrome is a freeware web browser developed by Google.
In addition to standard browsing, it supports a rich developing, debugging and profiling environment.
It supports plugins to add to its functionality and was used extensively for developing the website.
Additional plugins include:
React Developer Tools - supports React debugging inside of Chrome.
Postman - supports performing POST, GET, etc. directly to a back end server from Chrome, important when debugging front-end back-end issues.
JSON Formatter - supports taking a big blob of JSON text returned usually from a server and beautify it into a human readable form.
GSDD - supports downloading sub-repos from GIT hub, when there are issues getting stuff from GIT hub.
Screencastify - Screen recorder that support capturing and sharing screen recordings complete with voice overs for sharing issues and making tutorials.

roll.title: Github
details: GitHub is a web-based version control repository.
It is being used to open source the software for this website.

roll.title: Heroku
details: Heroku is a cloud based Platform as a Service, PaaS, used for web application deployment.
It was used as an easy way to deploy the React website via git.

roll.title: Amazon S3
details: Amazon S3 provides storage through web services interfaces
It was used to hold the images for the website.

roll.title: Amazon CloudFront
details: Amazon CloudFront is a worldwide content delivery network (CDN).
It was used to distribute the images for the website.

roll.title: shopify.com Store and Partner Program
details: The Shopify Partner Program consists of designers, developers, and creatives building ecommerce websites, themes, and apps using the Shopify platform.
It was used to create a shopify store, products, and collections that were accessed via the shopify-sdk covered above.

roll.title: Wordpress.com Blogs
details: WordPress.com is a blog web hosting service provider owned by Automattic, and powered by the open source WordPress.org software.
Used for creating English and French worpress.com blog sites that are access via the Wordpress endpoints covered above.

roll.title: Zoho.com
details: Zoho offers a suite of services including an email server.
Used to forward email sent to sweetlightstudios.com to other accounts on other servers.

roll.title: Sublime Text Programming Editor
details: Sublime Text is a proprietary cross-platform source code editor.
Used it for editing and testing everything on the Website via $ subl .
Used a group of plugins for additional functionality:
Package Control - necessary for installing the other plugins.
Sublime Linter - necessary for installing other linters.
SublimeLinter-contrib-eslint - I believe that ESLint is the best linter for ES6 Javascript.
Babel - Syntax definitions for ES6 JavaScript with React JSX extensions.
SublineCodeIntel - autocomplete for a variety of languages.
Color Highlighter - highlights color definitions with their actual color and provides a popup color picker to allow changing color easier.
CSScomb - CSS style formatter to beautify and organize contents of CSS files.
Git - git integration with Sublime text.
GitGutter - see git diff in sublime gutter.
Autoprefixer - prefix your CSS.
SASS - SASS support in Sublime Text.
SASS Build - SASS build system for Sublime Text 2.
Sublime on save build - trigger a build when you save.
SublimeLinter-html-tidy - Beautify HTML.

roll.title: Reflector 2
details: Reflector is a wireless mirroring and streaming receiver from AirSquirrels .
Used when making the explanatory videos and giving demos to display mobile devices on the desktop screen.

roll.title: Balsomic Markups
details: Balsamiq Mockups is a rapid wireframing tool that produces wireframes that have the whiteboard look.
It was used to design some of the layout for the website.

roll.title: Inkscape SVG Editor
details: Inkscape is a free and open-source vector graphics editor.
It was used to create the original site icon, that was replace prior to final website release.
